thread.title: Birmingham NatWest armed bank robbery: Major police incident as raider 'takes hostages'
thread.title_full: Birmingham NatWest armed bank robbery: Major police incident as raider 'takes hostages'

author: Anthony Bond
title: Birmingham NatWest armed bank robbery: Major police incident as raider 'takes hostages'
text:
Police cars at the scene of the incident (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Armed police sealed off a NatWest bank in Birmingham after reports a gunman was inside with hostages. 
Officers swooped on the branch in Northfield and a man has been arrested at the scene. 
An eyewitness described seeing a gunman take hostages with what looked like a 9mm pistol. 
West Midlands Police tweeted: "Specialist officers have sealed off NatWest, Northfield after reports an armed man is inside. Negotiators are on the scene." 
The force later added: "A man has now been arrested by officers at NatWest in Northfield." 
A police spokesman said: "Police received an emergency call at 11.45am reporting a man with a firearm inside NatWest bank in Bristol Road South, Northfield. The police cordon in Birmingham (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Traffic was stopped as police sealed off the area (Photo: PA) 
Bikaas Saleem, a local trader, told the Birmingham Mail : “A man had what looked like a 9mm pistol, he pulled it out before he went in. 
"There were civilian hostages in the bank. The first armed police turned up within minutes. 
“The police were using an air vent to talk to him. The whole of Bristol Road was locked off.” 
"Response and armed officers have contained the building and police negotiators are on the scene." 
We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.
